title: Modeling a Periodic Context - Angle in Metronome

content.question: Part A The graph of <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> and its dashed midline for two full cycles is shown. Five points, <math alttext="F"><mi>F</mi></math>, <math alttext="G"><mi>G</mi></math>, <math alttext="J"><mi>J</mi></math>, <math alttext="K"><mi>K</mi></math>, and <math alttext="P"><mi>P</mi></math>, are labeled on the graph. No scale is indicated, and no axes are presented. Determine possible coordinates <math alttext="open parentheses t comma h open parentheses t close parentheses close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math> for the five points: <math alttext="F"><mi>F</mi></math>, <math alttext="G"><mi>G</mi></math>, <math alttext="J"><mi>J</mi></math>, <math alttext="K"><mi>K</mi></math>, and <math alttext="P"><mi>P</mi></math>. Moving from left to right: Point F is at a maximum point. Point G is on the midline. Point J is at a minimum point. Point K is on the midline. Point P is at a maximum point.

frqParts.text: Part A The graph of <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> and its dashed midline for two full cycles is shown. Five points, <math alttext="F"><mi>F</mi></math>, <math alttext="G"><mi>G</mi></math>, <math alttext="J"><mi>J</mi></math>, <math alttext="K"><mi>K</mi></math>, and <math alttext="P"><mi>P</mi></math>, are labeled on the graph. No scale is indicated, and no axes are presented. Determine possible coordinates <math alttext="open parentheses t comma h open parentheses t close parentheses close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math> for the five points: <math alttext="F"><mi>F</mi></math>, <math alttext="G"><mi>G</mi></math>, <math alttext="J"><mi>J</mi></math>, <math alttext="K"><mi>K</mi></math>, and <math alttext="P"><mi>P</mi></math>. Moving from left to right: Point F is at a maximum point. Point G is on the midline. Point J is at a minimum point. Point K is on the midline. Point P is at a maximum point.

Part B The function <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> can be written in the form <math alttext="h open parentheses t close parentheses equals a cos open parentheses b open parentheses t plus c close parentheses close parentheses plus d"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>b</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mi>d</mi></math>. Find values of constants <math alttext="a"><mi>a</mi></math>, <math alttext="b"><mi>b</mi></math>, <math alttext="c"><mi>c</mi></math>, and <math alttext="d"><mi>d</mi></math>.

Part C Refer to the graph of <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> in part A. The <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math>-coordinate of <math alttext="J"><mi>J</mi></math> is <math alttext="t subscript 1"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, and the <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math>-coordinate of <math alttext="K"><mi>K</mi></math> is <math alttext="t subscript 2"> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </math>. (i) On the interval <math alttext="open parentheses t subscript 1 comma t subscript 2 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>,</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mfenced></math>, which of the following is true about <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> ? a. <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is positive and increasing. b. <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is positive and decreasing. c. <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is negative and increasing. d. <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is negative and decreasing. (ii) On the interval <math alttext="open parentheses t subscript 1 comma t subscript 2 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>,</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mfenced></math>, describe the concavity of the graph of <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> and determine whether the rate of change of <math alttext="h"> <mi>h</mi> </math> is increasing or decreasing.

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
